accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Kathryn McCarthy was a music teacher in Buffalo, N.Y. She was a lecturer in music at the University at Buffalo Evening School, 1929-1936 and director of music theory in the First Settlement School in Buffalo. Studied piano and music literature with Evelyn Choate, elementary theory with Mary Howard, took a director's course at Cornell University, 1913, courses at New York University, 1915, instrumentation and composition at Columbia University, studied composition, instrumentation, and pedagogy with Hugo Leichtentritt in Berlin, 1914, piano with F. Mufchim in Petrograd, 1921, composition, instrumentation, and pedagogy with Jean Gallon in Paris, piano with E. Monod in Paris, and studies with A. Madley Richardson and Arthur Newstead in New York City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Kathryn McCarthy Papers contain ten folders of materials related to McCarthy's music lessons in composition, counterpoint, and the Schillinger System. Teachers of McCarthy included A. Madeley Richardson (1868-1949) and Richard Benda (d. 1978).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series:

item.ref: I. Lesson Book in Composition and Counterpoint.
II. Correspondence. Correspondence to and from Schillinger method teacher, Richard Benda. Folders 2-10.
